children.name: Example - opens the PopOver initially on view show

parameters.name: target `jQuery`
parameters.description: The target of the Popover, to which the visual arrow will point to. **This parameter is required for a tablet OS.**

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **PopOver** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the PopOver element from DOM.

children.name: Close a popover when a button is clicked
popup.width
children.description: The width of the popup in pixels.

children.name: popup.height
children.description: The height of the popup in pixels.

children.name: popup.direction
children.description: The direction to which the popup will expand, relative to the target that opened it.Supported directions are `up`, `right`, `down`, and `left`.

children.name: pane.loading
children.description: The text displayed in the loading popup. Setting this value to false will disable the loading popup.

children.name: pane.layout
children.description: The id of the default Pane Layout.

children.name: pane.initial
children.description: The id of the initial mobile View to display.
